alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clermont; Clinton; Warren (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:27AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN CLERMONT, NORTHWESTERN BROWN, SOUTHEASTERN WARREN AND SOUTHWESTERN CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1127 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Loveland, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Loveland, Milford, Blanchester, Morrow, Camp Dennison, Woodville, Clarksville, Goshen, Newtonsville, Fayetteville, Midland, Butlerville, Pleasant Plain, St. Martin, Murdock, State Route 123 at State Route 132, Chasetown, Perintown, Day Heights and Dallasburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
